column4: does anyone know a good gnome c++ compiler I can get from the app installer?
burner: where can I get gcc?
sudo apt-get install gcc
sudo apt-get install g++
how do I run it?
run what? that command, open a terminal and do "sudo apt-get install g++"
it is command line
something like "g++ -o whatever whatever.cc" for instance will compile whatever.cc and output the binary whatever. You can do man g++ for a more thorough explanation of options
or you can install an ide that allows to compile within it. I personally like geany.
where do I get geany?
sudo apt-get install geany
awesome thanks
does geany let me make a new project or just files.. or is that a dumb question?
by new project what do you mean?
I have never worked with c++,I am gonna learn today, but my brother knows it and he said I need to make a new project not a new file
oh that may be because c++ is object oriented. I have never used c++
yeah it is probably that. will ask him about it, thanks
you can resize a partition by taking space off the end and you can resize partitions by adding space on the end. Otherwise, must format
so I can't make new partitions now? didn't think so
you can make new partitions if you have free space
I have one partition taking up the whole drive, so can I make a new partition?
you can resize that by taking space off the end and then create a new partition out of the space freed up
Cool, how do I do that?
you have to use the live cd
